meanings.definition: Favoring one side in a dispute over another
meanings.sent1: She showed partiality towards her best friend during the argument.
meanings.sent2: The judge's decision seemed partial towards the plaintiff.
meanings.sent3: It was clear that the referee had a partial view of the game.
meanings.sent4: Her partial support for the team was evident in her cheers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's partial grading system caused some students to feel unfairly treated.

meanings.sent1: He only had a partial understanding of the complex math problem.
meanings.sent2: The painting was beautiful but remained partial without the final touches.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked delicious, but it was only partial as it was missing frosting.
meanings.sent4: The story felt partial without the last chapter revealing the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle was challenging because some pieces were partial and hard to place.

meanings.sent1: The partial map showed only a portion of the hiking trail.
meanings.sent2: Her memory of the event was partial and missing key details.
meanings.sent3: The recipe was partial without the list of required ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The song felt partial without the chorus that tied it all together.
meanings.sent5: The project remained partial until all team members contributed their parts.
